meanings.definition: Resembling or relating to a bract.
meanings.sent1: The bracteal leaves were green and leafy.
meanings.sent2: The plant had delicate bracteal flowers.
meanings.sent3: The bracteal decorations added a touch of nature to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her bracteal dress fluttered in the wind like petals.
meanings.sent5: The bracteal design on the wallpaper looked like tiny leaves.

meanings.sent1: The bracteal plant had colorful leaves around its flowers.
meanings.sent2: The tree was covered in bracteal structures.
meanings.sent3: The bracteal arrangement made the garden look like a forest.
meanings.sent4: Her bracteal hair accessory stood out among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The bracteal pattern on the fabric resembled tiny shields.

meanings.sent1: The bouquet was bracteal, with layers of protective leaves.
meanings.sent2: The bracteal composition of the plant ensured its survival.
meanings.sent3: The bracteal structure of the building provided shade and beauty.
meanings.sent4: Her bracteal necklace was a symbol of nature's embrace.
meanings.sent5: The bracteal formation of the clouds resembled a protective shield.
